meanings.example: The room was quite silent after the announcement.
The soup was quite spicy despite its mild appearance.
She closed the door quietly so no one would wake.
He quietly organized the files before anyone arrived.
The train moved quickly through the countryside.
Call me quickly if the situation changes.

meanings.def: faster or taking less time than something else
meanings.example: Take the quicker route to avoid traffic.

meanings.def: fastest or requiring the least time
meanings.example: This is the quickest way to get downtown.
Dinner was a quick affair before the concert.
She was quick to offer help when the alarm sounded.
His quick mind spotted the pattern immediately.

meanings.def: the sensitive flesh beneath a fingernail or toenail
meanings.example: She clipped the puppy's nail too short and hit the quick.
The library was quiet despite the storm outside.
They enjoyed a quiet evening at home.
He chose a quiet tie for the interview.
We sat in the quiet of the empty chapel.
The teacher tried to quiet the anxious students.

meanings.def: in terms of quantity or measurable amount
meanings.example: The report compares the programs quantitatively.
He looked at me questioningly, waiting for an explanation.
She sighed querulously about the long wait.

meanings.def: in an old-fashioned yet charming way
meanings.example: The cottage was quaintly decorated with lace curtains.

meanings.def: in terms of qualities rather than quantity
meanings.example: The two proposals differ qualitatively in their goals.
The company reviews its budget quarterly.
Quarterly earnings rose this year.

meanings.def: a magazine or journal published four times a year
meanings.example: She writes for a literary quarterly.

meanings.def: with a feeling of nausea or unease
meanings.example: He queasily pushed the half-cooked fish aside.

meanings.def: in a strange or unusual way
meanings.example: The light flickered queerly before going out.

meanings.def: in a doubtful or suspicious manner
meanings.example: The funds were questionably sourced.
She raised an eyebrow quizzically at the suggestion.
He quixotically pledged to end all traffic jams within a year.

meanings.def: with a trembling voice or motion
meanings.example: The witness spoke quaveringly about the night of the storm.
The volcano has remained quiescent for decades.
Her quick-witted comeback ended the argument.
Most quadrupedal mammals rely on strong shoulder muscles.
The zoo exhibit features several African quadrupeds.
A square is a type of quadrilateral.
They mapped a quadrilateral field beside the stream.
The quadripartite agreement required unanimous consent.
We focus on the quality of our ingredients.
Curiosity is a quality she admires.
They sell quality furniture that lasts.

meanings.def: able to switch roles or appearances rapidly
meanings.example: The actor delivered a quick-change performance between scenes.
By dawn the streets were quiet and the unrest was quelled.
Rain finally quenched the wildfire.
With their thirst quenched, the hikers set off again.
The querulous neighbor called the landlord nightly.

meanings.def: meeting the required skills or credentials
meanings.example: We interviewed three qualified candidates.
Their support was qualified by a demand for more data.
The caf√©'s quirky decor drew curious customers.
He grew quarrelsome after only one drink.
She gave me a questioning look.

meanings.def: the act of asking questions, especially in an investigation
meanings.example: The suspect faced hours of questioning.

meanings.def: resembling royalty without an official title
meanings.example: The celebrity traveled with a quasi-royal entourage.
Their quick-eared spaniel alerted them to footsteps.
The board rejected the questionable accounting tactics.
Her conclusion is questionable given the limited data.

meanings.def: even after an exchange or repayment
meanings.example: Settle the bill and we'll be quits.

meanings.def: relating to the mystical teachings of the Kabbalah; esoteric
meanings.example: The novel weaves qabalistic symbolism into the plot.

meanings.def: identifying with or inclusive of LGBTQ+ identities
meanings.example: They found support in a vibrant queer community.

meanings.def: strange or out of the ordinary
meanings.example: Something smelled queer in the basement, so we checked the pipes.
One careless leak could queer the entire deal.
They stayed in a quaint cottage by the sea.
The festival has a quaint mix of music and crafts.

meanings.def: preserved by rapid freezing to retain quality
meanings.example: Use quick-frozen peas when fresh ones are out of season.
A quick-tempered response could make the dispute worse.

meanings.def: kept in isolation to prevent the spread of disease
meanings.example: The quarantined patients received meals through a sealed door.

meanings.def: describing a mattress or bed roughly sixty inches wide
meanings.example: They upgraded to a queen-size bed for extra room.
She carried herself with a queenly confidence.
His mother maintained a queenlike poise at the ceremony.
The novel elevates the quotidian routines of family life.

meanings.def: formerly belonging to someone or something
meanings.example: He met with a quondam colleague to discuss the merger.
The quick-sighted editor caught the error immediately.
He gave me a quizzical smile when I arrived early.

meanings.def: exceedingly idealistic in a way that ignores practicalities
meanings.example: Launching a solo mission to clean the ocean was a quixotic plan.

meanings.def: relating to the nature or qualities of something
meanings.example: We gathered qualitative data through interviews.

meanings.def: relating to quantity or measurable amount
meanings.example: The policy was based on quantitative analysis of survey results.

meanings.def: able to be expressed as a quantity
meanings.example: Customer satisfaction is not easily quantifiable.

meanings.def: notably apt and suitable for quoting
meanings.example: The coach delivered a quotable line after the upset win.

meanings.def: having four roughly equal sides or angles
meanings.example: Archaeologists uncovered a quadrate courtyard behind the temple.
The tile pattern alternates circles with quadrates.
They pursued justice with quenchless determination.
The committee serves as a quasi court for labor disputes.
Fans displayed a quasi-religious reverence for the singer.
